Some members of the State College Borough Council at a worksession last night said the Borough Water Authority is not run as efficiently as it could be but members disagreed on what action should be taken PERIOD

Several council members said they were displeased at the amount of time the authority has taken in locating wells and drilling them PERIOD

 said Councilman R PERIOD Thomas Berner who later added 

Berner said the Authority wastes too much time trying to negotiate with land owners where prospective well sites are located instead of just condemning the land PERIOD

The boroughs water supply has been a major concern for the council in the last few years because the supply has not been able to keep up with the rapidly growing area PERIOD

 said Councilman Jerry Wettstone PERIOD

Borough Manager Peter Marshall agreed the boroughs water system could be better run PERIOD

 Marshall said PERIOD

Members considered other options to the problem but made no concrete plans other than to research other state municipalities to see how different water programs are run PERIOD Berner said the program might be more efficient if it is contracted out to private water companies PERIOD

Councilwoman Ruth Lavin feared such action would encourage a monopoly of private water companies in the area PERIOD

Changing the structure of the authority would create few problems Marshall said PERIOD

The future of the Authorities Boards and Commissions Committee was also discussed at the meeting PERIOD The ABC committee a three member group consisting of council members helps determine which applicants are most qualified to serve on the boroughs various authorities boards and commissions and recommends them to council PERIOD

Council President Gary Wiser said the function could just as easily be run by council PERIOD

Council members also began discussing how to celebrate the boroughs  year anniversary to take place in  PERIOD

Berner suggested the municipalities current buildings and landmarks be photographed for permanent record PERIOD Council will consider enacting an adhoc committee for that purpose at a future meeting PERIOD
